job_description:
Product Specialist

As a Product Specialist at Zapare Technologies, you will bridge the gap between technology, business, and user needs. You will be responsible for defining product requirements, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and ensuring successful delivery of solutions that align with market needs and company goals.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Define and prioritize product features based on market research, user feedback, and business goals.
  • Conduct requirements gathering and documentation to align product functionality with end-user needs.
  • Collaborate closely with engineering and development teams to ensure technical feasibility and implementation accuracy.
  • Work with business SMEs (Subject Matter Experts) to gather insights and translate them into actionable product requirements.
  • Engage with clients and end-users to validate features, collect feedback, and drive product improvements.
  • Track product performance metrics and analyze data to inform continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Demonstrate strong analytical and problem-solving skills to manage competing priorities effectively.
  • Communicate product vision, updates, and priorities to executive leadership, clients, and internal teams.

Qualifications & Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field.
  • Strong understanding of software development processes and agile methodologies.
  • Working knowledge of cloud systems, data management, and API-driven architectures.
  • Excellent communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills.
  • Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment, taking ownership and leading initiatives effectively.
  • Domain knowledge in Healthcare, including Provider, Payer, and/or Patient processes.
  • Hands-on experience with EOB processing, reason codes, payer mapping, ERAs, and claims workflows.
  • Familiarity with EMR/EHR systems, HIPAA/HITECH regulations, and Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) operations.

Why Join Us:

  • Be part of a team driving innovation in the healthcare technology sector.
  • Collaborative and forward-thinking work culture that values creativity and ownership.
  • Competitive compensation and performance-based rewards.
  • Access to professional development programs and growth opportunities.
  • Opportunity to make a tangible impact on how healthcare organizations manage revenue and care delivery.

For more details, please Visit; www.zaparetech.com/career

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at hr@zaparetech.com

job_description:
AI Engineer – Internal Tooling & Automation

Location: Kerala (Preference will be given to candidates based in Kerala)

Role Summary: We are seeking a forward-thinking and passionate AI Engineer to join our Internal Tooling and Automation team. This role is a unique blend of software engineering, automation, and applied artificial intelligence. As an AI Engineer, you will play a key part in designing and building tools that empower operations teams, streamline business processes, and deliver seamless customer support experiences. This position focuses not only on building scalable systems but also on embedding AI and ML intelligence into those systems to maximize efficiency and reduce manual workload.

You will collaborate with multiple stakeholders across operations, technology, and business functions to understand pain points and identify opportunities for automation. From developing AI-enhanced internal applications to integrating SaaS platforms and deploying ML-driven solutions, your contributions will directly improve the productivity of teams and enhance the customer journey. This is a role for someone who enjoys problem-solving, thrives in dynamic environments, and is eager to apply AI in practical, business-critical scenarios.

Key Responsibilities: - Tool Development & Automation: Design, develop, and maintain internal software tools that incorporate automation features. Leverage AI/ML models to address repetitive workflows and enhance tool intelligence. - AI-Driven Solutions: Evaluate business processes to identify opportunities where AI/ML models can be deployed to optimize operations, reduce manual intervention, and increase accuracy. - Systems Integration: Build and manage integrations with SaaS platforms such as Hubspot, JIRA, and Zendesk using RESTful APIs, GraphQL, and modern web development practices. - Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with operations, customer support, and business teams to translate requirements into technical solutions. Provide AI-powered recommendations that improve processes and service delivery. - Maintenance & Troubleshooting: Monitor the performance of integrations and automation pipelines, resolving technical issues in a timely manner to ensure minimal business disruption. - Documentation: Develop comprehensive documentation for internal tools, integration workflows, and AI/ML models to ensure knowledge sharing and scalability. - Continuous Improvement: Research and adopt the latest advancements in AI/ML frameworks, automation practices, and web technologies. Regularly propose enhancements to existing systems and workflows. - User Experience Focus: Ensure tools and solutions are intuitive, reliable, and designed to provide maximum ease of use for internal stakeholders.

Knowledge, Skills, and Capabilities: - Strong background in core web technologies: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. - Proven expertise in developing APIs (RESTful & GraphQL). - Hands-on experience with backend frameworks such as Express.js (Node.js), Django (Python), or Spring Boot (Java). - Proficiency in scripting (Python, Bash) for automation, data handling, and workflow optimization. - Familiarity with AI/ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch) and knowledge of deploying models in production environments. - Understanding of integrating ML solutions into existing business systems and ensuring real-time performance. - Excellent problem-solving abilities, with a detail-oriented and analytical approach. - Strong collaboration and communication skills with the ability to interact effectively with diverse teams. - Capable of handling multiple projects independently and delivering within deadlines.

Preferred Qualifications: - Experience working with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, especially leveraging their AI/ML services. - Experience with APIs specific to Hubspot, Zendesk, or JIRA. - Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, DevOps practices, and ML deployment workflows. - Exposure to Natural Language Processing (NLP) for automating text-heavy workflows. - Experience in creating dashboards or monitoring tools to track the impact of AI-driven automation.

What We Offer: - An opportunity to work on challenging and impactful projects where AI is applied to solve real operational problems. - A collaborative and supportive work environment that encourages learning, experimentation, and professional growth. - Exposure to modern technologies and platforms in AI, ML, automation, and cloud computing. - Career growth opportunities, including mentorship, certifications, and chances to lead projects as you progress. - A workplace culture that values innovation, ownership, and continuous improvement.

Why Join Us? This role is perfect for someone who is excited about the potential of AI and automation to transform the way businesses operate. You will directly contribute to building intelligent systems that make a tangible difference to both employees and customers. If you are a problem-solver at heart, driven by curiosity, and eager to push the boundaries of technology, we invite you to join our team.

Note: Preference will be given to candidates from Kerala.

Employment Type: Full-time Experience Level: Mid-Senior Level Work Experience: 4 - 8 Years

job_description:
Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) Lead

Position Summary

The GRC Lead will spearhead the strategic governance, risk management, and compliance agenda to enhance the organization's cybersecurity resilience and ensure regulatory adherence. This pivotal role involves owning the development, implementation, and continuous improvement of the GRC framework, ensuring alignment with business objectives, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices. The GRC Lead will manage GRC operations, lead cross-functional teams, engage executive leadership, and drive strategic risk decisions to safeguard organizational resilience.

Key Responsibilities

Strategic Governance & Leadership - Lead the design, execution, and maturation of the organization’s comprehensive GRC strategy, encompassing policy governance, risk management frameworks, compliance programs, and continuous improvement initiatives. - Own the governance structure, including policy lifecycle management, control frameworks, and compliance awareness programs. - Align GRC objectives with business goals and regulatory mandates through close collaboration with executive leadership and key stakeholders. - Provide leadership, mentoring, and development support to GRC analysts and related teams.

Risk Management & Compliance Oversight - Direct risk identification, assessment, mitigation strategies, and control effectiveness reviews across the enterprise. - Oversee compliance operations, including audit management, regulatory assessments, and compliance reporting, to ensure adherence to global standards (ISO 27001, NIST, GDPR, PCI-DSS, SOC2). - Champion risk appetite definition and risk tolerance monitoring aligned with organizational priorities.

Process Improvement & Tooling - Guide the selection, deployment, and optimization of GRC tools and platforms (e.g., RSA Archer, ServiceNow GRC) to enable scalable risk and compliance management. - Drive automation efforts to improve risk intelligence, compliance tracking, and reporting accuracy. - Identify and implement best practices and process improvements to enhance operational efficiency and risk visibility.

Collaboration & Communication - Serve as the primary liaison for GRC matters across IT, Security, Legal, Compliance, and Business units. - Translate complex risk and compliance information into clear, actionable recommendations for executive leadership and technical teams. - Lead training, awareness programs, and communication efforts to embed a culture of governance and risk mindfulness. - Engage with external partners, auditors, and regulators for GRC-related assessments and benchmarking.

Required Qualifications

  • 7–8 years of progressive experience in Governance, Risk, and Compliance within cybersecurity or related fields.
  • Proven leadership in managing GRC programs, teams, and strategic initiatives.
  • Deep expertise in regulatory standards and frameworks (ISO 27001, NIST, GDPR, PCI-DSS, SOC2).
  • Strong background with GRC platforms such as RSA Archer, ServiceNow GRC, or similar.
  • Experience managing audits, risk assessments, compliance initiatives, and regulatory interactions.
  • Excellent strategic thinking, interpersonal, and communication skills.
  • Relevant certifications such as CISA, CISM, CISSP, CRISC, or PMP are highly desirable.

Preferred Skills

  • Experience with GRC automation and integration within DevSecOps or cloud security contexts.
  • Familiarity with IT and security control frameworks (CIS Controls, MITRE ATT&CK).
  • Industry experience in regulated sectors like finance, healthcare, or government.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a data-driven mindset.

Professional Attributes

  • Strategic and visionary leader with the ability to influence at all levels.
  • Collaborative and team-oriented approach with proven mentoring skills.
  • Detail-oriented, quality-focused, and proactive in risk anticipation.
  • Passionate about continuous learning and adapting to emerging cybersecurity trends.

Contact Information: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at merin.cb@arttechgroup.com
summary: Lead GRC strategy, risk management, and compliance to enhance cybersecurity resilience. Own framework development, implementation, and continuous improvement for regulatory adherence.

Techversant is seeking an experienced HR Generalist to join our dynamic team. The HR Generalist will play a crucial role in supporting various HR functions, including payroll processing & management, performance management, employee relations, HR policies, and procedures, compensation management & HR operations activities for the location. The ideal candidate should have 3-6 years of HR experience, excellent interpersonal skills, and a strong understanding of HR best practices. This is a challenging and rewarding opportunity for someone looking to make a significant impact in a fast-paced environment.

Roles and Responsibilities

  1. Payroll Processing:
    • Ensure accurate and timely processing of payroll for employees, including reviewing timesheets, calculating overtime, deductions, and benefits.

  2. Performance Management:
    • Coordinate and assist in the performance management process, including goal-setting, performance evaluations, and feedback sessions.
    • Provide guidance to managers and employees on performance-related matters, including addressing performance concerns, developing performance improvement plans, and recognizing outstanding achievements.

  3. Employee Relations:

  4. HR Policies and Procedures:

    • Regularly review and update employee handbooks, HR manuals, and related documents.
    • Provide training and guidance to employees and managers on HR policies, procedures, and compliance requirements.
  5. Onboarding:
    • Conduct new employee orientations and ensure a smooth onboarding experience.
  6. HR Data Management and Reporting:
    • Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records, including personal information, employment history, benefits enrollment, and performance evaluations.
    • Generate HR reports and metrics for management, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
    • Ensure data integrity and confidentiality, complying with data protection regulations.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with integrity.

  • Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills.

Job Published: 09, Oct 2025 Closing Date: 16, Oct 2025

Brief Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and innovative AI/ML Engineer with deep experience in Large Language Models (LLMs), Generative AI, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and multimodal AI involving audio and video processing. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience building and integrating cutting-edge AI solutions, fine-tuning open-source and proprietary models, and deploying them into production environments.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and deploy solutions using LLMs (GPT, LLaMA, Mistral, Claude, etc.) for real-world applications.
  • Implement and optimize RAG pipelines combining vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS) with LLMs.
  • Fine-tune transformer-based models using Hugging Face, LoRA, QLoRA, PEFT, or similar frameworks.
  • Work with generative AI models for text, image, audio, and video generation (e.g., Stable Diffusion, Whisper, AudioLM, DreamBooth, SDXL, etc.).
  • Design and integrate multimodal systems that can process and generate content across different formats.
  • Deploy models using ONNX, TorchServe, Triton, or custom APIs.
  • Collaborate with DevOps and MLOps teams for model versioning, deployment, and monitoring.
  • Research, prototype, and implement the latest advancements in generative AI and foundation models.
  • Ensure ethical AI practices, model alignment, and bias mitigation.
  • Optimize models for performance, latency, and resource efficiency.

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with AutoGPT, Agentic AI systems, or LangGraph.
  • Knowledge of RLHF, alignment training, and custom dataset curation.
  • Exposure to MLOps tools like MLflow, Weights & Biases, or Kubeflow.
  • Contribution to open-source AI projects or publications in relevant areas.

Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of hands-on experience in AI/ML engineering.
  • Proficient with Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, and ML libraries (e.g., Hugging Face Transformers, LangChain, OpenAI, etc.).
  • Strong understanding of LLMs, tokenization, attention mechanisms, and transformer architectures.
  • Experience with fine-tuning, prompt engineering, and in-context learning.
  • Knowledge of vector databases, embeddings, and RAG-based architectures.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure) and scalable AI infrastructure.
  • Experience working with Docker, Kubernetes, and GPU optimization.
  • Solid grasp of audio and video processing models.
  • Passion for innovation and staying updated with the latest research and trends.
summary: Seeking an AI/ML Engineer with 2+ years of experience in LLMs, Generative AI, and RAG. Responsibilities include developing, fine-tuning, and deploying cutting-edge AI solutions.

With over 400 engineers, InApp combines deep technical expertise with a strong customer-centric approach.

Role Overview

We are looking for a Technical Presales Architect to join our Presales & Solutioning team. This role focuses on the technical dimension of presales—bridging client needs with InApp’s delivery capabilities. The ideal candidate will work closely with the CRO/Head of Presales, Delivery, and Technology teams to craft high-quality solutions, lead technical discussions with prospects, and support proposal development.

Key Responsibilities

Solution Design & Architecture: - Analyze RFPs/RFIs and client requirements to design optimal technical solutions leveraging InApp’s capabilities. - Collaborate with Delivery and Practice Leads to define architecture, technology stacks, and integration strategies.

Technical Engagement with Prospects: - Lead deep-dive technical discussions, demos, and workshops with prospects to understand challenges and articulate solutions. - Present architectural approaches, frameworks, and design rationale to both technical and business stakeholders.

Proposal Development & Documentation: - Contribute to technical sections of proposals, including architecture diagrams, effort estimates, assumptions, and risk mitigation. - Support pricing discussions from a technical feasibility and effort standpoint.

Collaboration & Knowledge Sharing: - Partner with Sales, Delivery, and Technology teams to ensure alignment between proposed solutions and delivery capabilities. - Contribute to reusable solution frameworks, case studies, and accelerators for future opportunities.

Market & Technology Awareness: - Stay updated on emerging technologies, tools, and methodologies relevant to InApp’s service offerings. - Identify opportunities to incorporate modern technologies (AI, Cloud, Data, DevOps, etc.) in client proposals.

Required Skills & Experience

Experience: 10–15 years in software architecture, solution design, or technical presales in an IT services environment.

Technical Expertise: - Strong knowledge of modern application architectures — Cloud-native, Microservices, APIs, DevOps practices, and CI/CD. - Hands-on understanding of at least one major cloud platform (AWS, Azure, or GCP). - Familiarity with frontend, backend, and data engineering technologies.

Presales & Communication Skills: - Proven ability to engage clients in technical conversations and translate business needs into scalable technical solutions. - Strong documentation, presentation, and estimation skills.

Collaborative Mindset: - Ability to work cross-functionally with Sales, Delivery, and Leadership teams in a fast-paced environment. - Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving, and storytelling abilities.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience supporting U.S.-based or international clients in presales or solutioning roles.
  • Exposure to multiple domains such as BFSI, Healthcare, Retail, or Manufacturing.
  • Certifications in cloud platforms (AWS Solutions Architect, Azure Architect Expert, etc.) are an added advantage.
summary: Seeking a Technical Presales Architect with 10-15 years of experience to design solutions and lead technical discussions. Role involves client engagement, proposal development, and collaboration with internal teams.
